text: just looking at first project with HubSpot. Considering data structure. I want to create various category views showing post categories, then when clicked show category archive filtered by post tag. Is all this achievable with standard built in functionality of HubSpot CMS? It looks that way to me from documentation I've seen so far

Question for the HubSpot team - Why is there a limit of 3 levels deep for nested groups of inputs (fields) in modules? Is there any plan to increase this so we can go deeper? Since they're necessary for Repeater Options, and sometimes Display Conditions (since we can only use one operand and operator), it limits what we're able to do with modules and sometimes makes it impossible to accomplish something without an unintuitive workaround. Even just being able to go one or two levels further would make a huge difference although I'm mostly just curious why that limitation is even there.
I agree, 1 level deeper would make a huge difference in a lot of modules I've created. :pray:
Does anyone in this Slack channel use Workamajig?
i have a HubSpot hosted  Backgroundvideo that is not playing, is this only for me, or does anyone else experience this?

We are currently work on a site that uses HubSpot CMS for the marketing pages (on toot domain), Shopify will handle the e-commerce functionality on <http://shop.domain.com|shop.domain.com>. They wanted as many pages as possible to be hosted in HubSpot and wanted to create a lot of landing/affiliate pages.
Are there any plans in the pipeline to allow for bootstrap 4 column classes in the visual designer?
you can do this on your own if you code the templates

I have a client making reference to enabling 'add modules' for some of the template files we developed for them. After selecting the template from landing pages they would like to be able to add in simple modules like a line of text where one does not exist in the template. Is this possible? If so, how can I enable this functionality?
Go into the template, then in the inspector, click + Add and search for a flexible column module.

Actually the best way to do this is using <https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/tutorials/drag-and-drop-areas>

It’s like Flexible columns but works in 2 dimensions, left-right and up-and down.
<@U7SL518D6> I keep forgetting that this exists…

Ok, I have a little different scenario to put together here. In a form, the consent checkbox field needs to be in a 2nd column of the form. Other fields can of course be dragged into a 2nd column. The consent field doesn’t have that same drag functionality. Anyone know of a way to get that field moved from the full width bottom of the form?
